In regards to the tournament, I think the only fair and balanced way to go 
about it is to use the non-registered version of Gladiator. The number of 
levels are limited, cheats don't exist, and the scenario picker is fairly 
useless. If people completed the demo and sent in their save files, the 
person with the highest total score would be declared winner. It would also 
save a lot of administrative trouble.

My only problems with the scenario editor are that there's limited 
punctuation available in the text box and that some of the map tiles are 
next to useless. That's why I created the pillar .PIX files... to replace a 
couple of useless tiles.
     -T.
